textos_fuente.text: About Us | Christ Presbyterian Church Home Who We Are Mission Ministries Small Groups Men and Women College Youth Children Resources Podcasts Giving Connect Contact Home Who We Are Mission Ministries Small Groups Men and Women College Youth Children Resources Podcasts Giving Connect Contact WHO WE ARE Who We Are About Us What We Believe Meet Our Staff WORSHIP We are fundamentally a worshiping community. Our worship is a conversation, a dialogue, between God and us. We hear from him as he calls us to worship, as we hear his word read, explained, and applied, as we hear of his forgiveness, and as we are sent out with his blessing. We respond by singing, confessing our sins, listening to his word, giving, receiving the sacraments, and by celebrating God’s blessing over us. Order of Worship Worship has one object. God, who alone is worthy of worship. Worship has two contexts. Publicly with God’s people and privately in our own homes. Worship has three audiences. God, the object of our worship, us, his people, and the watching world. SMALL GROUPS MEN’S AND WOMEN’S MINISTRIES COLLEGE MINISTRY YOUTH MINISTRY CHILDREN’S MINISTRY “ What comes to mind when we think about God is the most important thing about us. ” — A. W. Read Pastor David's introduction below to learn more about this new resource and how you can tap into it. Then, when you are ready, use the RightNow "signup" button at the bottom of the page or click the image to get started. Introducing RightNow Media: A Resource for Your Family by David C. Mauldin The staff of PCPC is excited to put a powerful resource into your hands. RightNow Media is a video streaming service. It is something like Netflix but with two crucial differences. First, the content is entirely Christian. The videos are geared primarily toward learning and growth, not entertainment. There are resources for families and children, and some of the childrenâs programs are Bible stories and that sort of thing. However, the content for adults is for devotional use, Bible study, and learning. Second, you do not pay a subscription fee. The church does, then we offer it free to you. How might you use RightNow Media? You could use it to learn more about a book of the Bible or an issue like parenting or marriage. You could use it with friends in a small group setting. Our church will be using it for classes and LifeGroups. We see this as a tool for discipleship and growth. The staff is training to make the most of the features RightNow offers, such as posting our own classes on it for our church family. Like any tool, it is not perfect. It is broadly evangelical. You will not find teachings that are outside the evangelical mainstream, but there are over 25,000 videos, so you might encounter something that is not strictly within the bounds of our Essential Tenets. For example, you may find a pastor advocating believerâs baptism as opposed to infant baptism. Another example is the variety of views you will find on the end times; our Essential Tenets allow for some diversity on that point. Nevertheless, your staff is confident that the content is solid and biblical. If you encounter a concern, let us know. We can tailor the content available to our church family, though we cannot preview all 25,000 videos! When the church uses videos in, for example, a class or LifeGroup, the series will have been approved by our staff. We will also be making recommendations for different series we think you will find rewarding. HOW TO ACCESS THE RESOURCES: Your first step is to sign up for a RightNow account. You can do this by clicking the SIGNUP button below. After you are registered, you can use RightNow Media from the internet or download the app for easier access. I hope you will sign up and check out the resources. We think this is going to be a powerful tool for spiritual growth within our church. Parents especially, donât miss the good stuff here for your children. Board & Staff At the Palm Springs Chamber of Commerce, our Board of Directors is comprised of dedicated leaders from diverse industries who are committed to advancing the economic vitality of our community. Together, they provide strategic direction, foster partnerships, and advocate for policies that enhance the business climate in Palm Springs. Our professional staff works tirelessly alongside the Board to implement initiatives, organize events, and support the day-to-day needs of our members. With a passion for the city’s growth and prosperity, they provide essential services, deliver programs, and ensure that businesses have the resources they need to thrive. Together, the Board of Directors and the staff form a dynamic team focused on creating a vibrant business environment and making Palm Springs a great place to live, work, and do business. Dr. David C. Mauldin, senior pastor Email: david@palmcitypres.org Pastor David began his ministry with our church in August 2017. David earned his B.A. at Milligan College (TN), M.Div. at Louisville Presbyterian Theological Seminary (KY), and D.Min. at Beeson Divinity School (Samford University in Birmingham, AL). Prior to coming to PCPC, he served as pastor of Westminster Presbyterian Church in Mobile, AL, for 14 years. He has also served churches in Georgia, Tennessee, and Indiana. Favorite book (other than The Bible ): The Brothers Karamazov Favorite movie: A River Runs Through It If I were a superhero, I would be: Spiderman Pastor Al Rivett, Interim Executive pastor Email: al@palmcitypres.org Pastor Al is a commissioned
lay pastor with specialized interim pastor training. He served as transitional
pastor of Christ Presbyterian Church in Barnwell, South Carolina, for two
years. Al has been active in church leadership since 1996. His home congregation
is Indian River Presbyterian, where he has served as an elder. He has been
through the visioning process twice, once as an elder and once as a pastor. He
and his wife, Donna, make their home in Fort Pierce. Al's professional career was mainly in community development and the non-profit world. He was the director of Habitat for Humanity in St. Lucie County. He worked for the St. Lucie County Chamber of Commerce as both Executive Vice President and Director of Governmental Relations. He has served on the boards and chaired numerous community organizations. Favorite book (other than The Bible ): I am a fan of author C.J. Box and his Joe Pickett series. Favorite movie: I've seen the last two seasons of The Chosen in the theater. My favorite non-Christian movie is Independence Day . If I were a superhero, I would be: Barry Allen, The Flash Jessica Waltersdorff, director of next generation ministry Email: jessica@palmcitypres.org Born and raised in Stuart, Jessica is a true Florida native. She
holds a bachelor's degree in vocal performance from the University of North
Florida, an educational specialist degree in mathematics from Nova Southeastern
University, and a master's in organizational leadership from Gonzaga
University. Jessica has a diverse work background from florist to 911 emergency operations to educator in both public and private schools. She has taught all
ages from K-12 in music and mathematics. Jessica is married to Adam, and they
have three children: Logan (25), Lily (21), and Cara (17). Jessica enjoys the
natural beauty of God's creation. She spends her free time
boating/snorkeling, gardening, and quilting. Favorite book: Pride and Prejudice Favorite movie: I have many "go to" movies for multiple
occasions If I were a superhero, I would be: Thor, because I am confident
and willing to take on any challenge. Trish Jones, receptionist Email: trish@palmcitypres.org A native Ohioan, Trish lived with her family in multiple states as her Baptist minister father served in various churches. Following a stint in Okinawa with her Air Force husband, she eventually landed in Texas and then on to South Florida. After working in such diverse positions as a sales coordinator, purchasing agent and project manager for electrical contractors, medical staff coordinator, newspaper and magazine editor and publisher, the US Government, and finally, business administrator for a South Florida church, Trish tried retirement twice â with no success or sense of purpose or fulfillment. A passionate follower of Jesus Christ and a long-time Bible teacher and author of Bible studies, Trish welcomes every opportunity to serve the Lord by serving His people in whatever capacity He makes available. Favorite book: The Bible Favorite movie: The Ultimate Legacy If I were a superhero, I would be: The Wasp - doing good deeds with great power, while invisible KELLY TULLIDGE, COMMUNICATIONS COORDINATOR Email: kelly@palmcitypres.org K elly moved to Palm City from Syracuse, NY in 2014 with her husband, Rob, and their children, Ethan (22) and Anna (21). She holds a bachelor's degree in business administration from SUNY Oswego. Previously, Kelly worked in the financial industry and the public school system; she was also a stay-at-home mom. In her free time, Kelly enjoys running, reading, traveling, and spending time outside. Favorite book: One Thousand Gifts by Ann Voskamp or anything by Fredrik Backman Favorite movie: Notting Hill If I were a superhero, I would be: Elastigirl REVA ROGERS, DIRECTOR OF TRADITIONAL MUSIC Email: reva@palmcityp re s.org Reva earned her Bachelor of Arts in vocal performance with emphasis in choral conducting and vocal pedagogy from Southern Virginia University. After five years in Arizona as an elementary music teacher, Reva is thrilled to return to her hometown of Palm City with her husband, to raise their three children and continue her career as both a high school choir director and private vocal instructor. Favorite book: Portions of the Sea Favorite movie: West Side Story If I were a superhero, I would be: Captain Marvel Robb Huff, PRINCIPAL ORGA nist Email: robbhuff81@gmail.com Born and raised in Kansas, Rob came to Florida in 1998 and
has lived here ever since. He has a Bachelor of Arts in music education and a master's degree in
accounting. Rob works as a contractor at FPL as a project
manager. When he's not working, Rob enjoys family time with his wife, Robyn,
and their kids, Payton, Addy, and Harrison ... and as much college football as he can fit in! Favorite books: Mere Christianity and Les Miserables Favorite movie: The Italian Job If I were a superhero, I would be: ... I'm not really into superheroes. Does Jason Bourne count? David Amerson, youth ministry specialist Email: amerson@palmcitypres.org A Jensen Beach native, David is married to his wife, Hannah, and they have a baby girl, Freya Lee. He brings both heart and experience to this role and will be leading our middle and high school students. While David works full-time in the aerospace industry, his true passion lies in sharing the gospel and caring for others. He has served with Youth With A Mission (YWAM), reaching communities both in the U.S. and abroad. Favorite books: Where the Red Fern Grows Favorite movie: Tron If I were a superhero, I would be: The Green Lantern Jennifer Osborne, Children's Ministry Specialist Email: jennifer@palmcitypres.org Jennifer Osborne is from Maryland and holds a degree in elementary education from the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga. In high school and college, she enjoyed playing soccer. She has been a teacher for over 25 years in private child care schools. She has taught infants through school-age children, including during after-school and summer programs. Jennifer is married and has a grown son. She enjoys being outdoors, enjoying nature and animals. Favorite book (other than The Bible ): books about modern - day miracles or events that happened clearly because of divine intervention Favorite movie: I like movies, but I would much rather see a live show! I saw Daniel at Sight and Sound in PA last Christmas , and it was one of my favorites! Elders Following the New Testament model, our church is governed by elders. (The word Presbyterian means âruled by elders.â) Elders are congregation members who are elected by the congregation. Each elder serves a three-year term and is eligible to be elected to a second term. We have twelve active elders. These elders plus the pastors of the church are called âthe session.â Class of 2024: Pat Douglas, Patricia Rosendahl, Bob Shubert, Andrea Wood Class of 2025: Susan Hastings, Sharon Johnson, Kevin Levengood, Russ Rykse Class of 2026: Ron Bartnick, Beth Castle, Heather Floyd, Steve Romig Deacons Following the New Testament model, deacons provide care and leadership to our congregation. At PCPC, deacons are organized by the needs of the congregation and the individual gifts of the deacons. We have a hospital visitation team, a homebound visitation team, a bereavement team, a new member assimilation team, a hospitality team, a prayer team, and more. Palm City Church - Who We Are Home New Here? Who We Are Next Steps Baptism Growth Track Grow Team City Groups One Year Bible Prayer Serve My City Share Your Story Next Gen Palm City Kids Students Watch Give THE RIGHTEOUS WILL FLOURISH LIKE A PALM TREE Psalm 92:12 Leadership The story of Palm City Church began during an unexpected moment at Curtis Hixon Park in downtown Tampa. What started as a simple family trip quickly turned into something much bigger—God placed an extraordinary love for the people of Tampa Bay in the hearts of Pastors Brian and Kristen Bagwell, and the mission was clear: to build an authentic, inspiring, life-giving church that people could call home, where they would encounter the life-changing message of Jesus. Since launching in January 2022, Palm City Church has been a community of people, from diverse experiences, living out the vision to belong to Jesus, believe together, and become disciples of Christ. Every week, we gather to share in life, grow in faith, and make a lasting impact on our city and beyond. Brian and Kristen have been married since 2007 and are raising their three kids—London (2010), Rex (2013), and Banner (2015)—to love Jesus and love people. They are passionate about creating a space where individuals and families can find their place, their purpose, and experience the transformative power of the gospel. Palm City Church is more than just a building—it’s a family. It’s a place where you can truly belong, experience authentic community, and be equipped to live out your calling. And while we celebrate all that God has done, we are eagerly anticipating the Best Days Ahead as we continue to grow, reach new people, and see them flourish. Vision Whether new to church, have followed Jesus for years, or are looking for a fresh start, you're welcome here. Our desire is for you to experience a real, authentic connection with God and find a flourishing community that walks alongside you. We keep our focus simple: everything we do is designed to help people BELONG to Jesus, BELIEVE together, and BECOME disciples who make a difference. Belong to Jesus Our city is filled with a diverse community, and no matter where you come from, true belonging is found in Jesus. At Palm City Church, we aren’t just offering a place to gather—we’re pointing people to Christ. In Him, you are fully known, deeply loved, and eternally secure. Discover the transforming power of belonging to Jesus. Believe Together Faith was never meant to be walked alone. We believe life-change happens when we pursue Jesus together. At Palm City Church, we inspire one another to grow in faith, encourage each other, and build each other up. As we grow in our relationship with God, we experience the power of believing in community. Together, we BELIEVE. Become a Disciple Following Jesus is more than a moment—it’s a lifelong journey of growing in His truth, living out His teachings, and becoming more like Him every day. At Palm City Church, we are committed to inspiring, equipping, and empowering people to walk in their God-given purpose as fully devoted disciples of Jesus. Take your next step toward discipleship and BECOME. Values 01 Jesus | Our Message Colossians 1:28 Values 02 People | Our Passion 1 Corinthians 9:22 Values 03 Faith | Our Lifestyle 2 Corinthians 5:7 Values 04 Excellence | Our Spirit Mark 7:37 Values 05 Generosity | Our Joy 2 Corinthians 9:7 Values 06 Growth | Our Mindset Luke 2:52 Values 07 Fun | Our Expression Philippians 4:4 Beliefs HOLY BIBLE The Holy Bible, and only the Bible, is the authoritative Word of God. It alone is the final authority in determining all doctrinal truths. In its original writing, it is inspired, infallible, inerrant (2 Timothy 3:16; 2 Peter 1:20-21; Proverbs 30:5; Romans 16:25-26). JESUS CHRIST Jesus Christ is God the Son, the second person of the Trinity. On Earth, Jesus was 100% God and 100% man. He is the only man ever to have lived a sinless life. He was born of a virgin, lived a sinless life, performed miracles, died on the cross for mankind, and thus, atoned for our sins through the shedding of His blood. He rose from the dead on the third day according to the Scriptures, ascended to the right hand of the Father, and will return again in power and glory (John 1:1, 14; John 20:28; 1 Timothy 3:16; Isaiah 9:6; Philippians 2:5-6; 1 Timothy 2:5). REGENERATION For anyone to know God, regeneration by the Holy Spirit is absolutely essential (John 6:44, 65). REPENTANCE Repentance is the commitment to turn away from sin in every area of our lives and to follow Christ, which allows us to receive His redemption and to be regenerated by the Holy Spirit. Thus, through repentance we receive forgiveness of sins and appropriate salvation (Acts 2:21; 3:19; 1 John 1:9). JESUS' BLOOD The Blood that Jesus Christ shed on the Cross of Calvary was sinless and is 100% sufficient to cleanse mankind of all sin. Jesus allowed Himself to be punished for both our sinfulness and our sins, enabling all those who believe to be free from the penalty of sin, which is death (1 John 1:7; Revelation 1:5, 5:9; Colossians 1:20; Romans 3:10-12, 23, 5:9; John 1:29). BAPTISM IN THE HOLY SPIRIT Given at Pentecost, it is the promise of the Father, sent by Jesus after His Ascension, to empower the Church to preach the Gospel throughout the whole earth (Joel 2:28-29; Matthew 3:11; Mark 16:17; Acts 1:5, 2:1-4, 17, 38-39, 8:14-17, 10:38, 44-47, 11:15-17, 19:1-6). THE GIFTS OF THE HOLY SPIRIT The Holy Spirit is manifested through a variety of spiritual gifts to build and sanctify the church, demonstrate the validity of the resurrection, and confirm the power of the Gospel. The Bible's lists of these gifts are not necessarily exhaustive, and the gifts may occur in various combinations. All believers are commanded to earnestly desire the manifestation of the gifts in their lives. These gifts always operate in harmony with the Scriptures and should never be used in violation of Biblical parameters (Hebrews 2:4; Romans 1:11, 12:4-8; Ephesians 4:16; 1 Timothy 4:14; 2 Timothy 1:6-7; 1 Corinthians 12:1-31, 14:1-40; 1 Peter 4:10). HEALING OF THE SICK Healing of the sick is illustrated in the life and ministry of Jesus and included in the commission of Jesus to His disciples. It is given as a sign, which is to follow believers. It is also a part of Jesus' work on the cross and one of the gifts of the Spirit (Psalm 103:2-3; Isaiah 53:5; Matthew 8:16-17; Mark 16:17-18; Acts 8:6-7; James 5:14-16; 1 Corinthians 12:9, 28; Romans 11:29). GOD'S WILL FOR PROVISION It is the Father's will for believers to become whole, healthy, and successful in all areas of life. But because of the fall, many may not receive the full benefits of God's will while on Earth. That fact, though, should never prevent all believers from seeking the full benefit of Christ's provision in order to better serve others. 1. Spiritual (John 3:3-11; 2 Corinthians 5:17-21; Romans 10:9-10). 2. Mental and Emotional (2 Timothy 1:7, 2:11; Philippians 4:7-8; Romans 12:2; Isaiah 26:3). 3. Physical (Isaiah 53:4-5; Matthew 8:17; 1 Peter 2:24). 4. Financial (Joshua 1:8; Malachi 3:10-11; Luke 6:38; 2 Corinthians 9:6-10; Deuteronomy 28:1-14; Psalm 34:10, 84:11; Philippians 4:19). SECOND COMING Jesus Christ will physically and visibly return to earth for the second time to establish His Kingdom. This will occur at a date undisclosed by the Scriptures (Matthew 24:30, 26:63-64; Acts 1:9-11; 1 Thessalonians 4:15-17; 2 Thessalonians 1:7-8; Revelation 1:7 TRINITY There's one God, eternally existent in three persons: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit. These three are co-equal and co-eternal (1 John 5:7, Genesis 1:26; Matthew 3:16-17, 28:19; Luke 1:35; Isaiah 9:6; Hebrews 3:7-11). VIRGIN BIRTH Jesus Christ was conceived by God the Father, through the Holy Spirit (the third person of the Trinity) in the virgin Mary's womb; therefore, He is the Son of God (Matthew 1:18, 23-25; Luke 1:27-35; Isaiah 7:14). REDEMPTION Man was created good and upright, but by voluntary transgression he fell; his only hope of redemption is in Jesus Christ, the Son of God (Genesis 1:26-31, 3:1-7; Romans 5:12-21). SALVATION We are saved by grace through faith in Jesus Christ; His death, burial, and resurrection. Salvation is a gift from God, not a result of our good works or of any human efforts (Ephesians 2:8-9; Galatians 2:16, 3:8; Titus 3:5; Romans 10:9-10; Acts 16:31; Hebrews 9:22). SANCTIFICATION Sanctification is the ongoing process of yielding to God's Word and His Spirit in order to complete the development of Christ's character in us. It is through the present ministry of the Holy Spirit and the Word of God that the Christian is enabled to live a godly life (1 Thessalonians 4:3, 5:23; 2 Corinthians 3:18, 6:14-18, 2 Thessalonians 2:1-3, Romans 8:29, 12:1-2, Hebrews 2:11). JESUS CHRIST INDWELLS ALL BELIEVERS Christians are people who have invited the Lord Jesus Christ to come and live inside them by His Holy Spirit. They relinquish the authority of their lives over to Him thus making Jesus the Lord of their life as well as Savior. They put their trust in what Jesus accomplished for them when He died, was buried, and rose again from the dead. (John 1:12; John 14:17, 23; John 15:4; Romans 8:11; Revelation 3:20). THE CHURCH The Church is the Body of Christ, the habitation of God through the Spirit, with divine appointments for the fulfillment of Jesus' Great Commission. Every person who is born of the Spirit is an integral part of the Church as a member of the body of believers. There is a spiritual unity of all believers in our Lord Jesus Christ (Ephesians 1:22, 2:19-22; Hebrews 12:23; John 17:11, 20-23). SACRAMENTS Water Baptism: Following faith in the Lord Jesus Christ, the new convert is commanded by the Word of God to be baptized in water in the Name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit (Matthew 28:19; Acts 2:38; Mark 16:16; Acts 8:12, 36-38, 10:47-48). The Lord's Supper: A unique time of communion in the presence of God when the elements of bread and grape juice (the Body and Blood of the Lord Jesus Christ) are taken in remembrance of Jesus' sacrifice on the Cross (Matthew 26:26-29; 1 Corinthians 10:16, 11:23-25). Marriage: We believe marriage is defined in the Bible as a covenant, a sacred bond between one man and one woman, instituted by and publicly entered into before God (Matthew 19:4-6). RESURRECTION Jesus Christ was physically resurrected from the dead in a glorified body three days after His death on the cross. In addition, both the saved and the lost will be resurrected; they that are saved to the resurrection of life and they that are lost to the resurrection of eternal damnation (Luke 24:16, 36, 39; John 2:19-21, 20:26-28, 21:4; Acts 24:15; 1 Corinthians 15:42, 44, Philippians 1:21-23, 3:21). HEAVEN Heaven is the eternal dwelling place for all believers in the Gospel of Jesus Christ (Matthew 5:3, 12, 20, 6:20, 19:21, 25:34; John 17:24; 2 Corinthians 5:1; Hebrews 11:16; 1 Peter 1:4 HELL After living one life on Earth, the unbelievers will be judged by God and sent to Hell where they will be eternally tormented with the Devil and the Fallen Angels (Matthew 25:21; Mark 9:43-48; Hebrews 9:27; Revelation 14:9-11, 20:12-15, 21:8). Through this 13-week group, youâll discover what to expect in the days ahead and whatâs ânormalâ in grief. Since there are no neat, orderly stages of grief, youâll learn helpful ways of coping with grief, in all its unpredictabilityâand gain solid support each step of the way. Join us on Tuesdays, beginning September 9, at 12:00-2:00 p.m., in our office conference room. To learn more and register, please visit www.griefshare.org . Questions? Please contact Florine Blackshear at f.dian.b@gmail.com . Loss of a Spouse Seminar Next date TBD Click the image to learn more on the GriefShare website. Do you dread the lonely days and nights? Wonder what to do with your spouseâs belongings? Feel like your brain is in a fog? Unsure of how youâll go on? At this seminar youâll discover: Other people understand and have found ways to make it through Why it wonât always hurt so much Reasons for hope Practical tips for coping with the death of a spouse Surviving the Holidays Seminar Next date TBD Grief is harder around the holidays. This seminar will equip attendees to deal with the challenges of changed holiday traditions, draining social events, emotional triggers, and more. Learn practical ideas on how to navigate the season. Click the image to learn more on the GriefShare website. GriefShare Support Program The GriefShare support program features biblical, Christ-centered teaching focusing on grief topics associated with the death of a loved one. We use the GriefShare DVD seminar series presented by nationally respected grief experts and real-life stories of people. Past participants have related how helpful the information and discussions were to them. Many grieving people find they are only beginning the work of healing when friends or family returned to their daily life routines. Too often people, including Christians, tend to hide their grief instead of allowing it to do the God-given work for which it is intended. Donât allow fear of what others may think to keep you from taking advantage of what could help you. Confidentiality is very much a part of this program. Your bereavement experience may be recent or not so recent. This grief support program offers encouragement, comfort, and help in grieving the death of a spouse, child, parent, sibling, other family member, or friend. No matter what the cause of your loved oneâs death, this is an opportunity to be around people who understand what you are feeling. There is a process in recognizing the symptoms of being stuck in grief, and how to work through the bondage you may experience with certain emotions. This learning and sharing experience will deliver valuable information about facing your new normal in life and renewing your hope for the future. The PCPC GriefShare group began a new 13-week on January 10, 2024 . The projected end date is April 3. They meet in the office conference room. Registration is not required but preferred . To register, please call the church office at 772-286-9958. There is a one-time cost of $20.00 for a GriefShare program workbook. Childcare is not available. Welcome to Palmetto Presbyterian Church At Palmetto Presbyterian, you will find a Community of real people who are more concerned about where you are going than where you have been. Our purpose is to ask the right questions, not provide easy answers. Here, you will find unconditional Acceptance and acts of Love . In the midst of asking tough questions, we pull good news from the gospel. Our worship service is a Joyful and uplifting experience where the focus is not “what must I do to be saved,” but what Christ has already done to save me. In true Presbyterian form, we start with God. Anything we Do is in response to God’s Grace . MomCO: Fall 2025 Make It Awkward In a world that values polish over vulnerability, we're reclaiming the power of awkwardness. Why? Because awkward is authentic and charming. It's a breath of fresh air. Sometimes in our quest to be seen as competent, professional, and sophisticated, we forget the value of being real. We're entering a new era of earnestness.
